name: Boot9Strap 3DS Firmware File
summary: Learn about .FIRM files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Instead of .BIN files, Boot9Strap uses FIRM files for payloads. FIRM files are typically placed and located in the "boot9strap" folder on the SD card of the Nintendo 3DS.

description: A FIRM file is a firmware file used by Boot9Strap, a program used to install custom firmware on a Nintendo 3DS video game console. It contains data used to modify a Nintendo 3DS for various purposes, such as adding support for software, modifying a game, or providing boot-up directions. FIRM files are commonly used for storing Luma3DS firmware.

instructions: Most users do not need to open FIRM files on a computer. Instead, they install FIRM files directly on a Nintendo 3DS gaming console with Boot9Strap. However, users can also parse, extract, and build 3DS Firmware FIRM files on their computer with the free firmtool utility.
